{"step_by_step_thinking": "The oral cavity is a complex environment where a variety of microorganisms thrive. These include bacteria, fungi, viruses, and protozoa. Among these, bacteria are the most numerous. The majority of oral bacteria are either facultative anaerobes or strict anaerobes. Facultative anaerobes can survive in both oxygen-rich and oxygen-poor environments, while strict anaerobes can only survive in oxygen-poor environments. Considering the oral environment, which can fluctuate between oxygen-rich and oxygen-poor conditions, it would make sense that facultative anaerobes would be more prevalent.", "answer_choice": "D. Facultative anaerobes"}
